Class EfsScheduledExecutor

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Thread
org.efs.timer.EfsScheduledExecutor
All Implemented Interfaces:
Runnable
public abstract class EfsScheduledExecutor extends Thread
Executes given timer, IEfsAgent pairs at a specified time. When task timer expires, timer event is dispatched to IEfsAgent via EfsDispatcher.dispatch(Consumer, IEfsEvent, IEfsAgent).

Schedule methods are used to create timers with various delays, returning a timer object which can be used to cancel the timer or check its status. Methods scheduleAtFixedRate(String, Consumer, IEfsAgent, Duration, Duration) and scheduleWithFixedDelay(String, Consumer, IEfsAgent, Duration, Duration) create and execute timer tasks which run periodically until canceled.

Unlike java.util.concurrent.ScheduledExecutorService, efs scheduled executor does not support delay or period < zero. A repeating fixed delay or repeating fixed rate period must be > zero. A zero single-shot delay or initial delay must be ≥ zero.

All scheduled methods accept relative delays and periods as arguments and not absolute times or date.

Creating an EScheduledTimer

efs scheduled timers can be created in two ways: one at start up by defining them in -Dorg.efs.timer.configFile=<config file> scheduledExecutors block or programmatically using EfsScheduleExecutor.Builder to create a EfsScheduledExecutor instance. See EfsScheduledExecutorConfig for details on configuring an efs scheduled executor.

Note: efs scheduled executors are required to have a unique name. This allows efs scheduled executor instances to be retrieved using getExecutor(String). An attempt to create an executor with a named equaling an existing executor's will result in an exception.

Usage Example

This code example assumes that an efs scheduled executor named "fast-timer" has already been created. 
import java.time.Duration;
import java.time.Instant;
import org.efs.dispatcher.IEfsAgent
import org.efs.timer.EfsScheduledExecutor;
import org.efs.timer.EfsScheduledExecutor.IEfsTimer;
import org.efs.timer.EfsTimerEvent;

public class MyAgent implements IEfsAgent {
    private static final String EXECUTOR_NAME = "fast-timer";
    private static final String UPDATE_TIMER_NAME = "update-timer";

    // Verify that at least one update is received over the past minute.
    private static final Duration TIMER_DELAY = Duration.ofMinutes(1L);

    private Instant mLatestUpdate;
    private IEfsTimer mUpdateTimer;

    public MyAgent() {
    }

    public void startup() {
        // Do some work at a fixed delay.
        final EfsScheduledExecutor executor = EfsScheduledExecutor.getExecutor(EXECUTOR_NAME);

        mUpdateTimer = executor.scheduleWithFixedDelay(UPDATE_TIMER_NAME, this::onTimeout, this, TIMER_DELAY, TIMER_DELAY);
    }

    public void shutdown() {
        stopTimer();
    }

    private void onUpdate(final AppUpdate update) {
        mLatestUpdate = update.timestampAsInstant();

        // Do update work here.
        ...
    }

    private void onTimeout() {
        final Duration delta = Duration.between(mLatestUpdate, Instant.now());

        // Did an update arrive within the last minute?
        if (delta.compareTo(TIMER_DELAY) > 0) {
            // Yes. Take necessary actions.
            ...
        }
    }

    private void stopTimer() {
        if (mUpdateTimer != null) {
            try {
                mTimer.close();
            } catch (Exception jex) {
                // Do nothing.
            } finally {
                mTimer = null;
                mLatestUpdate = null;
            }
        }
    }
}

Charles W. Rapp

    Builder for constructing EfsDispatcher instance.

    EfsScheduledExecutor.CancelReason
    Provides reason for a timer no longer running.
    static interface 
    EfsScheduledExecutor.IEfsTimer
    A scheduled timer task which may be active, expired, or canceled.
    static enum 
    EfsScheduledExecutor.TimerState
    An efs-scheduled timer may be in one of three states: waiting for an active timer to expire, timer has expired and is no longer active, and timer is canceled, will never expire, and is no longer active.
    static enum 
    EfsScheduledExecutor.TimerType
    Enumerates supported timer type: single shot, repeated at a fixed rate, and repeated at a fixed delay.

      Parameters:

      Returns:
      true if timer expires and false if not.

    • shutdown

      public void shutdown()
      Shuts down this executor thread which results in all currently scheduled timers being canceled.

    • schedule

      public EfsScheduledExecutor.IEfsTimer schedule(@Nullable String timerName, Consumer<EfsTimerEvent> callback, IEfsAgent agent, Duration delay)
      Submits a single-shot task which expires after the given delay. This timer's expiration will not be reported if canceled prior to expiration detection.
      Parameters:
      timerName - timer name meaningful to caller. This name may be null or an empty string.
      callback - execute this task when timer expires.
      agent - dispatch timer expiration event to this agent's queue.
      delay - timer expires after this delay.
      Returns:
      an IEfsTimer instance which can be used to cancel the timer prior to execution.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if task, eobject, or delay is null.
      RejectedExecutionException - if delay < zero.
      IllegalStateException - if either agent is not registered with a dispatcher or this executor is shut down.

    • scheduleAtFixedRate

      public EfsScheduledExecutor.IEfsTimer scheduleAtFixedRate(@Nullable String timerName, Consumer<EfsTimerEvent> callback, IEfsAgent agent, Duration initialDelay, Duration period)
      Submits a periodic task which expires for the first time after the initial delay and then repeatedly at the periodic rate. In other words, expirations are initialDelay, then initialDelay + period, then initialDelay + (2 * period), and so on.

      The given timer will continue to be indefinitely executed until one of the following occurs:

      • The timer is explicitly canceled via the returned EfsScheduledExecutor.IEfsTimer instance.
      • The executor is terminated which results in all scheduled tasks being canceled.
      • The task's execution results in a thrown exception.
      Once a timer is canceled, subsequent executions are suppressed and isDone returns true.

      If any callback execution takes longer than its period, then subsequent executions may start late but will not result in multiple scheduled expirations.

      Parameters:
      timerName - timer name meaningful to caller. This name may be null or an empty string.
      callback - execute this task when timer expires.
      agent - dispatch timer expiration event to this agent's queue.
      initialDelay - timer first expiration after this delay.
      period - timer subsequent expirations after this period.
      Returns:
      IEfsTimer instance which can be used to cancel the timer prior to execution.

    • scheduleWithFixedDelay

      public EfsScheduledExecutor.IEfsTimer scheduleWithFixedDelay(@Nullable String timerName, Consumer<EfsTimerEvent> callback, IEfsAgent agent, Duration initialDelay, Duration delay)
      Submits a periodic task which expires for the first time after the initial delay and then repeatedly with the given delay between the termination of the previous expiration and the commencement of the next. This means that callback execution time does not impact scheduling the subsequent expirations. When the callback completes, the next expiration is current time plus delay.

      The given timer will continue to be indefinitely executed until one of the following occurs:

      • The timer is explicitly canceled via the returned EfsScheduledExecutor.IEfsTimer instance.
      • The executor is terminated which results in all scheduled tasks being canceled.
      • The callback's execution results in a thrown exception.
      Once a timer is canceled, subsequent executions are suppressed and isDone returns true.
      Parameters:
      timerName - timer name meaningful to caller. This name may be null or an empty string.
      callback - execute this task when timer expires.
      agent - dispatch timer event to this agent's event queue.
      initialDelay - timer first expiration after this delay.
      delay - timer subsequence expirations after this delay.
      Returns:
      IEfsTimer instance which can be used to cancel the timer prior to execution.

    • builder

      public static EfsScheduledExecutor.Builder builder()
      Returns a new EfsScheduledExecutor.Builder instance. It is highly recommended that builder() be called for each EfsScheduledExecutor created.
      Returns:
      a new {code Builder} instance.

    • loadScheduledExecutorsConfig

      public static void loadScheduledExecutorsConfig(String fileName)
      Loads each of the schedule executors contained in typesafe configuration file.
      Parameters:
      fileName - contains scheduled executor configurations.
      Throws:
      com.typesafe.config.ConfigException - if fileName contains an invalid scheduled executor configuration.

    • nextTimer

      @Nullable protected final org.efs.timer.EfsScheduledExecutor.EfsTimerImpl nextTimer()
